data.description:
A place to recommend and discuss movies that are devoid of wokeness. It can be an old movie, a foreign movie, or even a modern movie that happened to sneak through Hollywood's wokeness machine.  

This includes movies with strong, well developed characters of any race or sex. Just no "Mary Sues", or characters only in the movie for social justice reasons including "representation" or "normalization". 

This guild is Safe For Work. Only post mainstream movies. No pornography.

data.description:
The best place on Ruqqus for motivation, self-improvement, and growth as a person! Share your story, set goals, ask for advice, and support each other in our quest to become better than we once were! 

*“When we reach our lowest point, we are open to the greatest change.”* - Avatar Aang


* On-topic posts only thank you.
* Be excellent to each other; kindness is key to self-improvement.
* Follow all site-wide rules.
data.description_html:
The best place on Ruqqus for motivation, self-improvement, and growth as a person! Share your story, set goals, ask for advice, and support each other in our quest to become better than we once were!

“When we reach our lowest point, we are open to the greatest change.” - Avatar Aang

  • On-topic posts only thank you.
  • Be excellent to each other; kindness is key to self-improvement.
  • Follow all site-wide rules.
data.name: DecidingToBeBetter

data.description:
Collaboration in the fight against Cancel Culture and Censorship. Planning, organising and gathering in the fight against Censorship and Cancel Culture.

Tools for Fighting Back:

* [Unwoke HR. The Job Board For Unwoke Companies](https://ruqqus.com/post/2dky/unwoke-hr--the-job-board)

* [Rate My Professors](https://ruqqus.com/post/2ejp/rate-my-professors--a-website)

* [FightBack](https://fightback.law/). Legal Defence Attorneys available to help in the fight against the Left.

* [File a complaint with the FCC on censorship matters](https://ruqqus.com/post/2qat/the-fcc-are-taking-complaints-on)
data.description_html:
Collaboration in the fight against Cancel Culture and Censorship. Planning, organising and gathering in the fight against Censorship and Cancel Culture.

Tools for Fighting Back:

data.description:
You guessed it - Fuck YouTube! 

We are a guild dedicated to exposing the sins of YouTube, ranging from censorship to actively pushing propaganda. The hypocritical leadership of the wretched site must have their true colors shown at all costs.

We long for a world where YouTube at best corrects itself, and at worst is dead (and replaced by something else).

data.description:
A guild that lists non political guilds as a directory for new and old ruqqies to find interesting stuff!

TBTop may have left this site and called it "a failed experiment on a failed site" but we do not believe that. Apolitical guilds and guilds of substance are the key to developing ruqqus beyond what it is, beyond the grip of the American political cycle and being close to the edge of what many call "right-wing extremism". We are the key, we are +guildsofsubstance.

Guild transparency:

Posts kicked: 1

Users exiled: 10 total, 8 by TBTop

data.description:
Post any (preferably) open source platforms that support free speech

Please label your posts with "[Software]" if you are posting the actual program used to host communities (e.g. a link to Ruqqus' source code), "[News]" if you're talking about a software update, an instance's/software developer's change in policy, etc., or [Request] if you want people to suggest either software or already hosted instances (specify it in your title).

Label communities with the name of the software in brackets (e.g. "[Ruqqus] Ruqqus.com, a Reddit alternative").

Yanked posts do not need this format.

[Here is a list of some open source programs to host communities](https://ruqqus.com/post/1ia1/list-of-open-source-software-for).
data.description_html:
Post any (preferably) open source platforms that support free speech

Please label your posts with "[Software]" if you are posting the actual program used to host communities (e.g. a link to Ruqqus' source code), "[News]" if you're talking about a software update, an instance's/software developer's change in policy, etc., or [Request] if you want people to suggest either software or already hosted instances (specify it in your title).

Label communities with the name of the software in brackets (e.g. "[Ruqqus] Ruqqus.com, a Reddit alternative").

Yanked posts do not need this format.

Here is a list of some open source programs to host communities.
